intro: Solanum gnaphaloides, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South America. It is characterized by its silver-white, woolly leaves and small, violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant produces berries that range in color from green to yellow and eventually red as they mature. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is known for its toxic properties. Botanically, it belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is closely related to other toxic plants like belladonna and tobacco.
